description: Numbers n such that n remains prime through 3 iterations of function f(x) = 8x + 3.
comments: n, 8*n+3, 64*n+27 and 512*n+219 are primes. [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: Select[Prime[Range[14000]],AllTrue[Rest[NestList[8#+3&,#,3]],PrimeQ]&] (* The program uses the AllTrue function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 09 2015 *)
prog: (MAGMA) n: n in [1..450000] | IsPrime(n) and IsPrime(8*n+3) and IsPrime(64*n+27) and IsPrime(512*n+219)] [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
author: _David W. Wilson_
